svcsubsecinfo.para: All components must be clean and well lubricated before assembling, preferably with an SAE No. 90 lubricant.

warning.para: Be extremely careful when using any solvent to prevent personal injury or even death.
Wear eye protection and be sure to comply with OSHA or other maximum air pressure requirements when using compressed air to blow components dry.

step1.para: Assemble roller retainer assembly into bearing cup in housing.
Insert worm and input shaft assembly in housing.
Place other roller bearing retainer assembly in place on worm.
Insert worm bearing adjusting cup in housing bore.

Select an assortment of steel and paper shims sandwiched between two .0075 inch (0.191 mm) rubber-coated shims with the rubber-coated sides out, to make a shim pack that will achieve the correct worm bearing preload as stated in WORM BEARING PRELOAD. This is strictly a judgment and trial and error procedure. Assemble the shim pack, worm cover, and worm cover screws. Tighten cover bolts finger tight.
Assemble a new input shaft seal into housing or worm cover as required.

caution.para: Do not final tighten cover bolts immediately. Rotate input shaft assembly with one hand while slowly tightening bolts with the other hand to prevent damaging the bearing surfaces if the initial amount of shims selected is inadequate.

step1.para: Add or remove shims as necessary to achieve a beginning (light) preload, felt as a change in resistance to input shaft rotation, with the cover bolts finger tight. Final tighten worm cover bolts to 45 to 55 ft-lbs. (61 to 75 Nm). Then, using a torque wrench on the input shaft, check for correct worm bearing preload values:

item.para: Without input shaft (column) seal - 7 to 14 in-lbs. (0.8 to 1.6 Nm).
With input shaft (column) seal - 9 to 16 in-lbs. (1.0 to 1.8 Nm).

note.para: Always recheck preload after final tightening of cover bolts.
